titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. J. K. P. Gilliland, Indictment
CWG6610

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Cumberland Circuit Court

Commonwealth Plff
Against } Indictment for selling liquor to Soldiers
J. K. P. Gilliland Deft

This day came the Deft. as well as the Commonwealthy by Attorney, and by his Motion, and by consent of the attorney for the Commonwealth Said Deft confessed himself indebted to the Commonwealth in the Sum of Ten dollars, It is therefore ordered and adjudged by the Court that Plff recover of Said Deft the Sum of Ten dollars and the costs about this Prosecution expended and he may be taken

A copy of the Judgement rendered in the above action April Term 1865
att. J. M. Boles clk

James R. Page
Assistant Secretary of State
Enclosed please find Copies of Judgment vs. Gilliland -- & $10. to pay your fees. Please send the necessary papers & oblige

J. K. P. Gilliland &c
Tho. C. Winfrey
atty.

Commonwealth
v. } Copy of Jud.
J K. P Gilliland
